entry.title: [FF] Some old books (e.g. *The Arctic Home in the Vedas*) argue the original Indo-Ary
entry.content: Some old books (e.g. *The Arctic Home in the Vedas*) argue the original Indo-Aryan homeland was located above the Arctic Circle based on readings of the Vedas and Zoroastrian texts that are argued to only make sense based on them being set in the far north, such as descriptions of year-long days or descriptions of stars that imply they were observed from near the North Pole. Have any modern scholars addressed this argument and either supported or refuted it?
